news_header: Trump claimed he would never leave the White House after the 2020 election and made controversial remarks about journalists.
news_text: In a recent speech, Donald Trump stated he would never have left the White House after the 2020 elections. He made various controversial claims, including attacks on the media and comments about shooting journalists. Trump mentioned the use of bullet-resistant glass following an assassination attempt and dismissed concerns about violence. His campaign later attempted to clarify his remarks, suggesting he meant journalists need protection. Trump also expressed that he would lose to Kamala Harris if the election was fraudulent, despite polls indicating a tight race.
